SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

com.orchestranetworks.ui
Interface UIJavaScriptWriter

All Known Subinterfaces:
UIAjaxContext, UIComponentWriter, UIFormPaneWriter, UIResponseContext, UIServiceComponentWriter, UITableFilterResponseContext
public interface UIJavaScriptWriter

This interface provides methods to add some JavaScript in the current response context.

The JavaScript added with these methods is pure JavaScript. No need to precise the script tag (<script>).

For a HTML document, the JavaScript is stored in a special container at the end of the document, waiting to be executed at the right time.

The JavaScript is executed once the whole page is loaded and designed with the proprietary JavaScript code of EBX. So, there is no need to set on-load functions (such as window.onload = myFunctionToCallOnload;), because the execution context is almost after the on-load event. It is possible to manage instantly your HTML elements written with UIBodyWriter.add(String).

Using the command document.write("some HTML"); is not recommended, because the HTML will be written at the end of the document, namely after the closing HTML tag </html>, and not between two HTML pieces added with UIBodyWriter.add(String).

Since:
5.2.0
See Also:
UI Developer Guide

Method Detail

addJS

public UIJavaScriptWriter addJS(String aJavaScriptCode)
Adds some text to the JavaScript stream.

Parameters:
aJavaScriptCode - a piece of JavaScript code.

addJS_cr

public UIJavaScriptWriter addJS_cr()
Adds a carriage return to the JavaScript stream. The carriage return is important to properly split JavaScript's code lines.

addJS_cr

public UIJavaScriptWriter addJS_cr(String aJavaScriptCode)
Adds some text, then adds a carriage return to the JavaScript stream. The carriage return is important to properly split JavaScript's code lines.

Parameters:
aJavaScriptCode - a piece of JavaScript code.

addJS_openPreviewImage

public UIJavaScriptWriter addJS_openPreviewImage(String imageURL)
Opens an image preview panel for the given image URL.

Parameters:
imageURL - the URL of the image. Supported extensions: .bmp .gif .jpeg .jpg .png .swf.
Since:
5.2.4
See Also:
addJS_openPreviewImageFromVar(String)

addJS_openPreviewImageFromVar

public UIJavaScriptWriter addJS_openPreviewImageFromVar(String varName)
Opens an image preview panel from a JavaScript var containing the image URL.

Parameters:
varName - the name of the var containing the URL of the image. Supported extensions: .bmp .gif .jpeg .jpg .png .swf.
Since:
5.3.1
See Also:
addJS_openPreviewImage(String)

addJS_setButtonDisabled

public UIJavaScriptWriter addJS_setButtonDisabled(String buttonElement,
                                                  String isDisabled)
Disable or enable a button.

Buttons can be initially disabled with the method UIButtonSpec.setDisabled(boolean).

Example to reactivate a disabled button jsWriter.addJS("var myButton = document.getElementById(\"MyButtonId\");");
jsWriter.addJS_setButtonDisabled("myButton", "false");
-- or --
jsWriter.addJS_setButtonDisabled("document.getElementById(\"MyButtonId\")", "false");

Parameters:
buttonElement - a JavaScript expression evaluating to a button HTML Element.
isDisabled - a JavaScript expression evaluating to Boolean.
Since:
5.2.3

addJS_setExpandCollapseBlockExpanded

public UIJavaScriptWriter addJS_setExpandCollapseBlockExpanded(String expandCollapseBlockId,
                                                               String isExpanded)
Expand or collapse an expand/collapse block.

The id of the expand/collapse block is given by the method UIComponentWriter.startExpandCollapseBlock(UserMessage, boolean).

Example to expand an expand/collapse block with its id String expandCollapseId = componentWriter.startExpandCollapseBlock(aUserMessage, true);

componentWriter.addJS("var expandCollapseIdVar = \"").addJS(expandCollapseId).addJS("\";");
componentWriter.addJS_setExpandCollapseBlockExpanded("expandCollapseIdVar", "true");
-- or --
componentWriter.addJS_setExpandCollapseBlockExpanded("\"" + expandCollapseId + "\"", "true");

Parameters:
expandCollapseBlockId - a JavaScript expression evaluating to an expand/collapse block id.
isExpanded - a JavaScript expression evaluating to Boolean.
Since:
5.2.3

addJS_setStateToToggleButton

public UIJavaScriptWriter addJS_setStateToToggleButton(String buttonElement,
                                                       String state)
Set the state to a toggle button.

The JavaScript commands will not be executed.

Example to set a toggle button to OFF jsWriter.addJS("var myToggleButton = document.getElementById(\"MyToggleButtonId\");");
jsWriter.addJS_setStateToToggleButton("myToggleButton", "false");
-- or --
jsWriter.addJS_setStateToToggleButton("document.getElementById(\"MyToggleButtonId\")", "false");

Parameters:
buttonElement - a JavaScript expression evaluating to a button HTML Element.
state - a JavaScript expression evaluating to Boolean (true for ON and false for OFF).
Since:
5.2.3
